hero.page_title: Practicing Four Elements of Sanctuary Health Care
hero.author: Lauren Beatty

abstract.content: Eleven million undocumented immigrants in the United States, including children, face barriers to health. By practicing 4 elements of sanctuary health care, clinicians and organizations can help.

featured_quote.blockquote: “11 million undocumented immigrants in the US, including children, face barries to health. By practicing 4 elements of sanctuary health care, clinicians and organizations can help.

cards.title: Education from the AMA Code of Medical Ethics

card_group.title: Continuing Medical Education
card_group.description: Education from the AMA offers continuing medical education and other learning modules for physicians who strive to practice ethically. Topic filters allow users to select educational offerings that meet their individual needs.

references.text: Wallace LM, Turner A, Kosmala-Anderson J, et al. Evidence: Co-Creating Health: Evaluation of First Phase. London, England: Health Foundation; 2012. http://www.health.org.uk/mwg-internal/de5fs23hu73ds/progress?id=EOe09MTNkeTnqOr91ggJpFZikDutLX3qXgiUcFyk33s,&dl. Accessed September 29, 2017.

Boyle D, Harris M. The challenge of coproduction: how equal partnerships between professionals and the public are crucial to improving public services. London, UK: Nesta; December 2009. http://www.nesta.org.uk/sites/default/files/the_challenge_of_co-production.pdf. Accessed August 9, 2017.
Ramaswamy V, Ozcan K. The Co-Creation Paradigm. Stanford, CA: Stanford University Press; 2014.
Batalden M, Batalden P, Margolis P, et al. Coproduction of healthcare service. BMJ Qual Saf. 2016;25(7):509-517.
Mladenov T, Owens J, Cribb A. Personalisation in disability services and healthcare: a critical comparative analysis. Crit Soc Policy. 2015;35(3):307-326.

citation: AMA Journal of Ethics. November 2017, Volume 19, Number 11: 1132-1138
acknowledgements: Alan Cribb is a professorial fellow at the Health Foundation and is grateful for the associated funding.
